result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonny Aldama was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: Huber for diversion.  Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 4-21-2015; to Report by 6-19-2015.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges.

records.addlTxt: to Release Bond

Defendant Sonny  Aldama in court with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation with conditions:  6 months Rock Co Jail with Huber for diversion; any treatment deemed necessary; $268 costs, bond to apply; 117 days sentence credit if revoked.  Felon warnings advised.

Defendant Sonny  Aldama in court in custody with attorney Kristine A. Peshek.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Previous bond reinstated, bond conditions modified.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015, at 9:00 am.
